required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Minimally Invasive Surgery Techniques for One-level Degenerative Lumbar Deformities Correction
clinical_study.official_title: Minimally Invasive Surgery Techniques for One-level Degenerative Lumbar Deformities Correction

lead_sponsor.agency: Novosibirsk Research Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedics n.a. Ya.L. Tsivyan

clinical_study.source: Novosibirsk Research Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedics n.a. Ya.L. Tsivyan

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will be conducted at Research Institute of Traumatology and Orthopedics (NRITO) n.a. Ya.L.Tsivyan, Novosibirsk, Russia.
The current study is prospective pilot clinical study to demonstrate the possibility and effectiveness of performing modified technique of MIS TLIF, supplemented by segmental vertebrotomy, to correct segmental deformity of lumbar spine.
It is expected to enroll 10 patients aged 18-70 with segmental deformity of lumbar spine, caused by degenerative spondylolisthesis and/or degenerative stenosis.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The Study will be conducted in another research center. The Sponsor has changed.

primary_outcome.measure: Angle change at lumbar spine segment
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 Day of hospital discharge or 14th day of hospital stay (depends on what event comes first)
primary_outcome.description: Angle between endplates at the treated level of lumbar spine

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of Visual analog scale (VAS) back pain intensity
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the improvement of VAS back pain as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) - patient-reported pain intensity (0 - no pain, 10 - unbearable pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of Visual analog scale (VAS) leg pain intensity
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the improvement of VAS leg pain as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) - patient-reported pain intensity (0 - no pain, 10 - unbearable pain).

To observe the improvement of ODI as compared to baseline through follow-up terms Oswestry Disability Index - patient-reported physical and household activity. Minimum - 0 % (the best result, the patient has no limitations in physical activity). Maximum - 100% (the worst result, patient is not physically active at all).
To observe the Fusion rate (I, II, III or IV grade according to Tan). Grade I - complete fusion; Grade II - partial fusion; Grade III - unipolar pseudarthrosis; Grade IV - bipolar pseudarthrosis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 Day of hospital discharge or 14th day of hospital stay depends on what event comes first, 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the disc mobility at the treated level

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 Day of hospital discharge or 14th day of hospital stay depends on what event comes first, 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: To observe sagittal balance as compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 Day of hospital discharge or 14th day of hospital stay depends on what event comes first, 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: To observe disc height at the treated level as compared to baseline

intervention.intervention_name: Minimally invasive one-level lumbar deformity correction
intervention.description: The study treatment represents modified technique of MIS TLIF: one level screws fixation using Wiltse approach at one side, the other side - percutaneously, one level decompression, correction of segmental deformity by performing vertebrotomy and then intervertebral fusion.

overall_official.affiliation: Novosibirsk Research Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedics n.a. Ya.L. Tsivyan

facility.name: Novosibirsk Research Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedics n.a. Ya.L. Tsivyan
